headline: KAL’s cartoon

children.data: Dig deeper into the subject of this week’s cartoon:
For the first time since the 1960s, China’s population is shrinking
The age of the grandparent has arrived
No turning back for Xi Jinping
KAL’s cartoon appears weekly in The Economist. You can see last week’s

bodyText:
Dig deeper into the subject of this week’s cartoon:
For the first time since the 1960s, China’s population is shrinking (Jan 2023)
The age of the grandparent has arrived (Jan 2023)
No turning back for Xi Jinping (Oct 2022)
KAL’s cartoon appears weekly in The Economist. You can see last week’s here.

parts.description: How we saw the world

parts.headline: Disney’s troubles show how technology has changed the business of culture
parts.description: At 100, the mouse can still roar. But it faces a new kind of rival

parts.headline: Turkey could be on the brink of dictatorship
parts.description: President Erdogan could tip his country over the edge

parts.headline: Excess deaths are soaring as health-care systems wobble
parts.description: What lessons can be learned from a miserable winter across the rich world?

parts.headline: South Africa’s collapsing railway company is a cautionary tale
parts.description: A “developmental state” is less useful than keeping the lights on and trains running

parts.headline: How to sell to the young
parts.subheadline: Don’t try to dig what we all say
parts.description: A myth-busting memo for your boss

_metadata.articleBody:
Dig deeper into the subject of this week’s cartoon:
For the first time since the 1960s, China’s population is shrinking (Jan 2023)
The age of the grandparent has arrived (Jan 2023)
No turning back for Xi Jinping (Oct 2022)
KAL’s cartoon appears weekly in The Economist. You can see last week’s here.
